SENT.plain: A man in his 30s with dilated cardiomyopathy was admitted to our hospital with heart failure exacerbation
Despite optimal medical treatment, his renal function progressively declined to end-stage renal failure
Type 2 cardiorenal syndrome (CRS) was diagnosed and continuous ambulatory peritoneal dialysis was started
He died of a brainstem infarction 4 years later
Postmortem renal pathology revealed no significant changes in the glomeruli except for shrinkage, normal arterioles and focal degeneration of the tubules with peritubular fibrosis
This suggests that renal replacement therapy can be withdrawn from some patients with type 2 CRS
